title: sequence_concat and sequence encoders for combiner failing
body:
Hi,
I am experimenting with different encoders for the combiner. If I use something else than the standard concat combiner, I get an error in combiners.py, line 139, in __call__
    representations_size = representation.shape[2].value
since sequence and timeseries features have only a dimension of 2. I have specified main_sequence_feature to be sure the correct input is chosen.

I use the following model_dict:

model_definition = {'combiner': {
        'type': 'sequence_concat',
        'encoder': 'cnnrnn',
        'cell_type': 'rnn',
        'main_sequence_feature': 'DEBT_EQUITY',
        # 'main_sequence_feature': 'RATING',
        'conv_layers': [{'activation': 'relu',
                         'filter_size': 3,
                         'norm': None,
                         'num_filters': 32,
                         'pool_size': 2,
                         'pool_stride': 2,
                         'regularize': True}]},
                        'input_features': [{'name': 'TICKER',
                                            'type': 'category'},
                                           {'name': 'DEBT_EQUITY',
                                            'type': 'timeseries'},
                                           {'name': 'RATING',
                                            'type': 'sequence'},
                                           {'name': 'YEAR',
                                            'type': 'timeseries'}],
                        'output_features': [{'name': 'RATING_Label',
                                             'type': 'category'}],
                        }

Together with the attached dummy input.
[data_preprocessed.zip](https://github.com/uber/ludwig/files/3163449/data_preprocessed.zip)

Hope you can reproduce this...

Best
G
